Question
========
  
The table below is always part of the output SPSS gives when you run a multiple regression analysis. The dependent variable is school performance (SV), the independent variables are: gender (0 = girl, 1 = boy), ethnicity (1 = Dutch, 0 = other) and disruptive behavior (higher score corresponds to more disruptive behavior).

![](uu-Multiple-linear-regression-805-nl-tabel.jpg)

If all observed scores on the variable disruptive behavior listed in the data matrix are divided by two, then 
Answerlist
----------
* Changes the B value of the variable disruptive behavior
* Changes the Beta value of the variable disruptive behavior
* Changes the significance of the B value of the variable disruptive behavior
* Multiple answers from a, b and c are correct.
